intro: Ancistrocarphus keilii, commonly known as the Keil's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its structure includes a short stem with alternate leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
